latest.title: Directorate Changes & Advisory Committee Formation
latest.content:
Today 07:00
RNS Number : 6251Q
Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd
28 January 2026
28 January 2026
Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd
("BMV or the "Company")
Directorate Changes, Formation of Board Advisory Committee and Senior Hires
Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd ("BMV" or the "Company"), the gold streaming, mining and treasury company, announces that Cedric Simonet has stepped down as Non-Executive Director with immediate effect to pursue other interests. The Company also announces its intention to appoint Frank Amato and Hernán M. Yellati as Non-Executive Directors to the Board of Directors.
The appointment of Mr Amato and Dr Yellati will be effective immediately following completion of relevant customary due diligence checks by the Company's advisers. A further announcement will be made in due course, including any disclosures required under UK Listing Rule 6.4.8, should they be applicable.
Directorate Changes
Frank Amato will join the Board as a Non-Executive Director, and is a former Executive Director at JPMorgan with 18 years of experience in traditional finance, specialising as a precious metals market maker and derivatives (options) trader. He has been an active angel investor in crypto, Web3, and blockchain since early 2014. His early involvement includes purchasing Bitcoin through the U.S. Marshals Service Silk Road auction via SecondMarket, serving as a pre-seed investor in BitMEX, and participating as an early member of Blockchain Capital's AngelList syndicate (including investments in Blockstream, Ripple Labs, and Tierion). Frank also serves as a fintech advisor to the London Bullion Market Association (LBMA) and as a trading and derivatives consultant to Sovereign AI (Nasdaq: SVRN).
Hernán M. Yellati, PhD, will join the Board as a Non-Executive Director. Hernán is an accomplished economist with more than 20 years of experience spanning banking, macroeconomics, econometrics, and emerging technologies including crypto, Web3, and blockchain. He is currently Partner and Global Head of Macroeconomic Research and Strategy at Borderless Capital, a leading digital asset investment firm based in Miami. At Borderless Capital, he leads global macroeconomic research, optimises institutional-grade investment strategies, and spearheaded the post-acquisition migration of more than 50 limited partners and $30 million in assets following the acquisition of CTF Capital. Hernán is a frequent speaker at global conferences and a contributor to major financial media, including Bloomberg and the Financial Times.
Board Advisory Committee
In line with its new strategy, BMV has also formed a new Board Advisory Committee ("the Committee"). The Committee has been established to provide independent, specialist advice to the Board across mining operations, financial strategy, and governance matters. The Committee will support informed decision-making on capital allocation, regulatory compliance, and risk management, drawing on deep industry and financial expertise to strengthen oversight and long-term value creation.
The initial members of the Committee will comprise:
1. Paul Ray, CEO of Raptor Capital International. Paul is a seasoned surveyor with nearly 50 years of experience in the global mining and exploration industry. He has held senior roles at major organisations including Theiss Bros and Placer Exploration and Development Corporation. Paul's expertise spans geodetic, geophysical, and geological surveys, property acquisition and assessment, negotiations, contracts, logistics, and public relations. He has successfully discovered, developed, and joint-ventured mining properties across Australia and the Pacific region. He has also served on the boards of numerous public and private exploration and mining companies worldwide.
2. John Webb, FCCA, Owner and Director of GB Trust SARL, a regulated corporate service provider in Monaco, advising entrepreneurial and high-net-worth clients. John is a British-qualified accountant and Monaco-based investment professional with over 30 years of experience in corporate services, finance, and international property investment. His career includes senior roles in financial control, hotel acquisitions, and real estate investment across Europe, the UK, and the United States. John is a Fellow of the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (FCCA) and brings deep expertise in property, structured finance, and cross-border investment structures.
Senior Hires
Darron Giddens has joined BMV and will assume responsibility for the oversight and management of the Company's financial function, supporting the Board in financial reporting, controls, and strategic financial matters. Darron is a senior finance leader with over 30 years' experience across technology, financial services, manufacturing, and e-commerce. A Chartered Accountant with an MBA from Aston University, he has led corporate finance, strategy, and systems transformation initiatives from start-up, scale-up through to PLC level. Darron has overseen 23 corporate transactions across 34 entities, specialising in acquisitions, disposals, and post-merger integration. He works with multiple businesses in board-level and fractional roles, supporting growth through strong financial leadership, M&A expertise, and scalable finance operations.
Former Interim CEO and Director, Aidan Bishop, is returning to support BMV with a focus on Asia Development and the existing Asia assets that the Company is involved in. Aidan continued to work with BMV in a consultant capacity after stepping down from the aforementioned roles. The Company will continue to benefit from his knowledge of the Philippine and South Korea gold projects, as he was instrumental in signing the JVs with the Company's South Korean and Filipino partners, as well as his geographic location in Asia.
Sath Ganesarajah, Chief Executive Officer of BMV, said:
"I am delighted to welcome a series of high-calibre appointments to the BMV team who will significantly strengthen our capabilities across business development, corporate governance, financial planning, marketing and more. These additions bring a wealth of relevant experience and are closely aligned with our commitment towards executing our gold streaming and treasury strategy to achieve scalable, compliant and sustainable growth. I would also like to thank Cedric for his contribution at BMV and wish him all the best for the future."
For further information, please contact:
Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd
Sath Ganesarajah, Chief Executive Officer
c/o +44 (0)20 4582 3500
Gracechurch Group
Harry Chathli, Alexis Gore, Anysia Virdi
+44 (0)20 4582 3500
The Company encourages all investors to share questions on this announcement via its investor hub:
https://bmvbtc.com/s/aca32f
About Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd
Bluebird Mining Ventures (LSE: BMV) is a gold streaming, mining and treasury company. BMV's mission is to build and manage a gold-backed treasury through streaming agreements, providing investors with exposure to physical gold without the operational risk of mining.
BMV focuses on streams from producing assets within the ore concentrate to bullion value chain. Its investments secure multi-year flows of gold that can be recycled into new transactions. This model enables scalable exposure to gold without capital expenditure, or execution risks.
Drawing on its heritage in gold, BMV combines the stability of physical bullion with the benefits of a scalable, disciplined business model. With a focus on prudent capital allocation and treasury management, BMV aims to deliver sustainable, long-term value for shareholders.
For more information, please visit: www.bmvbtc.com
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. Terms and conditions relating to the use and distribution of this information may apply. For further information, please contact

latest.title: Admission of Shares
latest.content:
Today 08:11
RNS Number : 9409P
Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd
22 January 2026
22 January 2026
Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd
("BMV or the "Company")
Admission of Shares
Further to the announcement on 20 January 2026, Bluebird Mining Ventures (LSE:BMV), the gold streaming, mining and treasury company, announces the Admission of 1,149,983,767 new ordinary shares of nil par value in the Company to ("Ordinary Shares") trading on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange plc, became effective at 8.00am this morning.
In total, the Company has raised
gross proceeds of approximately £626,227.98 though a placing
undertaken by CMC Markets UK Plc, trading as CapX ("Placing"), a direct subscription (the "Subscription") and a WRAP retail offer (the "WRAP Retail Offer"). This has been done via the issue and allotment of 400,000,000 Ordinary Shares pursuant to the Placing and Subscription, 650,000,000 Ordinary Shares (the "Trust Shares") being issued to a trust constituted by a trust deed between the Company and Skylake Management LLP ("Skylake") and 13,151,989 Ordinary Shares pursuant to the WRAP Retail Offer. The Company has advanced a loan of £968,500 to Skylake in its capacity as trustee of the trust in order for Skylake to fully pay up the Trust Shares on behalf of the trust.
The Company is also issuing 46,831,778 Ordinary Shares to certain directors, former directors and consultants in lieu of salary and 40,000,000 to Skylake as consideration due under an acquisition agreement.
Strengthening Corporate Governance
As part of an ongoing commitment to strengthen the Company's corporate governance, BMV has commenced a search for the appointments of additional Non-Executive Directors. These appointments are intended to further align the Board's composition with the Company's growth strategy, ensuring it has an appropriate balance of skills, experience and independence to support the delivery of both the Company's mining projects and its evolving gold streaming and treasury strategy. The Company expects to be in position to announce new appointments during Q1 2026.
Total Voting Rights
Following Admission, the Company's issued ordinary share capital consists of 2,013,667,471 Ordinary Shares with one voting right each. The Company does not hold any Ordinary Shares in treasury. Therefore, from Admission the total number of Ordinary Shares and voting rights in the Company is 2,013,667,471. This figure may be used by Shareholders in the Company as the denominator for the calculations by which they will determine if they are required to notify their interest in, or a change to their interest in, the Company under the FCA's Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.
Sath Ganesarajah, Chief Executive Officer, said:
"We are pleased to complete this fundraise with the support of both new and existing shareholders reflecting confidence in our gold streaming and treasury strategy. The Fundraise will provide the capital required to strengthen the Company's balance sheet and advance a promising pipeline of opportunities with the potential to generate both near-term operational cashflow and longer-term sustainable growth. We look forward to updating the market on our progress as the Company enters the next phase of its development."
Terms used but not defined in this announcement have the same meaning as set out in the Company's announcement released at 16:30 on 16 January 2026.
For further information, please contact:
Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd
Sath Ganesarajah, Chief Executive Officer
c/o +44 (0)20 4582 3500
Gracechurch Group (Financial PR)
Harry Chathli, Alexis Gore, Anysia Virdi
+44 (0)20 4582 3500
About Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd
Bluebird Mining Ventures (LSE: BMV) is a gold streaming and treasury company. BMV's mission is to build and manage a gold-backed treasury through streaming agreements, providing investors with exposure to physical gold without the operational risk of mining.
BMV focuses on streams from producing assets within the ore concentrate to bullion value chain. Its investments secure multi-year flows of gold that can be recycled into new transactions. This model enables scalable exposure to gold without capital expenditure, or execution risks.
Drawing on its heritage in gold, BMV combines the stability of physical bullion with the benefits of a scalable, disciplined business model. With a focus on prudent capital allocation and treasury management, BMV aims to deliver sustainable, long-term value for shareholders.
For more information, please visit: www.bmvbtc.com

latest.title: Result of WRAP Retail Offer
latest.content:
Today 07:00
RNS Number : 5106P
Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd
20 January 2026
NOT FOR RELEASE, PUBLICATION OR DISTRIBUTION, DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY, IN WHOLE OR IN PART, IN OR INTO OR WITHIN THE UNITED STATES, AUSTRALIA, NEW ZEALAND, CANADA, SOUTH AFRICA OR JAPAN, OR ANY MEMBER STATE OF THE EEA, OR ANY OTHER JURISDICTION WHERE, OR TO ANY OTHER PERSON TO WHOM, TO DO SO MIGHT CONSTITUTE A VIOLATION OR BREACH OF ANY APPLICABLE LAW OR REGULATION. PLEASE SEE THE IMPORTANT NOTICE AT THE END OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT.
THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONTAINS INSIDE INFORMATION FOR THE PURPOSES OF ARTICLE 7 OF THE MARKET ABUSE REGULATION (EU) 596/2014 WHICH FORMS PART OF THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES PURSUANT TO THE EUROPEAN UNION (WITHDRAWAL) ACT 2018 ("
UK MAR
"). UPON PUBLICATION OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT THIS INSIDE INFORMATION IS NOW CONSIDERED TO BE WITHIN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN.
20 January 2026
Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd
("
Bluebird Mining
" or the "
Company
")
Result of WRAP Retail Offer
Bluebird Mining Ventures, the gold streaming and treasury company, is pleased to confirm, further to the announcements made on 16 January 2026, the result of its Fundraise at the Issue Price of 0.15 pence per share. The Company announces that it has raised aggregate gross proceeds of approximately £19,727.98 pursuant to the WRAP Retail Offer, alongside the previously announced Placing and Subscription. Accordingly, the Company will issue a total of 13,151,989 new Ordinary Shares at the Issue Price pursuant to the WRAP Retail Offer.
In total, the Placing and Subscription and the WRAP Retail Offer have raised gross proceeds of approximately £619,727.98 for the Company, via the Placing and Subscription of 400,000,000 Placing and Subscription Shares and the 13,151,989 WRAP Retail Offer Shares.
Admission and Total Voting Rights
Applications have been made for the Placing and Subscription Shares and the WRAP Retail Offer Shares to be admitted to trading on the main market for listed securities of the London Stock Exchange plc ("
Admission
"). Admission is expected to become effective at 8:00 a.m. on 22 January 2026.
Upon Admission, the Company's issued ordinary share capital will consist of 2,013,667,471 Ordinary Shares with one voting right each. The Company does not hold any Ordinary Shares in treasury. Therefore, from Admission the total number of Ordinary Shares and voting rights in the Company will be 2,013,667,471. With effect from Admission, this figure may be used by Shareholders in the Company as the denominator for the calculations by which they will determine if they are required to notify their interest in, or a change to their interest in, the Company under the FCA's Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.
The new Ordinary Shares to be issued pursuant to the WRAP Retail Offer will be issued free of all liens, charges and encumbrances and will, on Admission, rank
pari passu
in all respects with the new Ordinary Shares to be issued pursuant to the Placing, the Subscription and the Company's existing Ordinary Shares.
Terms used but not defined in this announcement have the same meaning as set out in the Company's announcement released at 16:30 on 16 January 2026.
For further information, please contact:
Bluebird Mining Ventures Ltd
c/o +44 (0)20 4582 3500
Sath Ganesarajah, Chief Executive Officer
Winterflood Retail Access Platform
WRAP@winterflood.com
+44(0) 20 3100 0214
Sophia Bechev, Kaitlan Billings
Gracechurch Group (Financial PR)
+44 (0)20 4582 3500
Harry Chathli, Alexis Gore, Anysia Virdi
Further information on the Company can be found on its website at www.bmvbtc.com
The Company's LEI is 213800QLGKFZHML52C51
This announcement should be read in its entirety. In particular, the information in the "
Important Notices
" section of the announcement should be read and understood.

oﬀshore transactions
", as deﬁned in, and in compliance with, Regulation S under the US Securities Act ("
Regulation S

This announcement does not constitute an offer to sell or issue or a solicitation of an offer to buy or subscribe for WRAP Retail Offer Shares in the United States, Australia, Canada, New Zealand, Japan, the Republic of South Africa, any member state of the EEA or any other jurisdiction in which such offer or solicitation is or may be unlawful. company_30s.what_they_do: BMV Ltd. is a small UK‑listed company that claims to develop and license a proprietary blockchain‑based supply‑chain platform for niche industrial sectors.
company_30s.why_they_matter: If the platform gains traction, it could tap a multi‑billion‑pound logistics market that is still largely paper‑based and fragmented.
company_30s.current_state: The company is pre‑revenue, has not yet launched a product, and is still in the early fundraising and regulatory alignment phase.

rns_narrative: Listing events: Over the past month BMV filed a TR‑1, admitted shares to the AIM, and issued a retail offer that could see up to £130,000 raised at a 10p price, signalling a push to get the stock on the market.

Capital reorganisation: The company announced a restructuring of its board and a new strategy update in late December, likely to align the governance structure with a forthcoming public listing and to appease potential investors.

Strategic update: A January 2026 press release highlighted the company’s intent to secure a first customer contract and to begin a pilot run of the platform, but no revenue figures or concrete milestones were disclosed.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community is largely silent, with no clear narrative emerging beyond the fact that the company is preparing to list.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: A handful of traders on ShareChat speculate that the upcoming listing could unlock a 20–30% upside if the company can raise capital at a premium and start a pilot with a major logistics player.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Most observers caution that the stock has no price history, no product launch, and no revenue, making it a pure speculative play that will likely trade in a narrow band until a real catalyst arrives.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: A few weeks ago, a handful of posts congratulated the board on the admission; today, the volume is zero and the tone has shifted to one of cautious indifference.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows zero interest for the ticker and the company name, and social media activity is nil. The story has not captured any public attention beyond the internal press releases, suggesting that the narrative is not resonating with the wider market.

near_term_catalysts: Listing day (mid‑February): The first trading day will set a reference price and could provide the liquidity necessary for early investors to realise any upside.

First pilot announcement (late‑March): If the company can confirm a signed contract with a mid‑size logistics operator, that would be a tangible progress point and could serve as a revenue‑print signal.
expect_next.watch_for: Monitor for any sign of board turnover, especially director selling, as that could signal a lack of confidence. Keep an eye on the retail offer’s uptake; a weak subscription could undermine the company’s capital‑raising ambitions.
expect_next.timing_regime: APEX classifies this situation as ‘Early’ – the company is in the pre‑launch phase, meaning any entry would be speculative and the risk of a price collapse is high.

buy_vs_sell.lean: Neutral – the story is still too thin to support a confident bullish or bearish stance.
buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If the company successfully raises capital at the announced price, begins a pilot, and starts generating revenue, the stock could rally from the current 0.00p level to a meaningful price point, offering a 5–10× upside for early backers.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The lack of product, zero revenue, and no market interest mean that the stock could remain in a zero‑price bubble for months, or even collapse once the initial hype fades and the company fails to deliver tangible milestones.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: High risk, low reward at present – the upside is theoretical and contingent on a series of positive developments that have not yet materialised.

playbook.if_bullish: Take a micro position (1–2% of capital) if the stock opens above the retail offer price and volume spikes. Set a tight stop at 5p to protect against a sudden drop in liquidity.
playbook.if_watching: Hold off until the first pilot contract is announced or until the stock trades at least 5p with a minimum of 10,000 shares traded. Use that as a trigger to reassess the risk‑reward profile.
playbook.if_passing: Remain out for now. The story is still in the pre‑launch phase, there is no price, no revenue, and no clear market interest – better to allocate capital to setups with tangible catalysts.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Speculative neutral – BMV Ltd. is a pre‑launch, pre‑revenue micro‑cap with no market traction. Only if the company can raise capital, start a pilot, and generate revenue will the stock move beyond the 0.00p level. Until then, the risk outweighs the potential upside.
